pros: Flexible working, international Tours, Excellent Colleagues
cons: Long periods away from home

pros: Everyone is friendly and helpful.
cons: Slow decision making and not much flexibility.

review_title: I learnt a lot but would never go back
pros: flexible start and finish times work from home nice office with private meeting rooms you do gain experience quickly because you're responsible for so many tasks.
cons: very low morale. always very stressed or constantly complaining about their pay. depressing environment. managers attitudes could be very inconsistent. they'd be friendly one minute and not so friendly in meetings with other teams. no real training. was left with no support dealing with sole challenging customers/situations. would not receive a reply for manager at times till next day... if that. this place is kind of soul crushing. I've never experienced this kind of treatment from a company before. it had a big impact on my mental health. if you are looking for a company that invests in your career development, run away fast and don't look back!

pros: Really great team with a culture that really cares about you.
cons: People are there for a long time without much internal promotion.

review_title: Not great. Do not feel valued at all.
pros: Friendly colleagues to work with. Flexibile with working from home.
cons: Pay is not competitive considering it's London based. Feedback from interview process wasn't great and internal promotion process isn't great. Promote people who've worked there 6 months vs someone whose been there multiple years.

job_title: Global Operations Administrator in City of London, England
pros: Flexibility working from home you make some good friends
cons: Pay is rubbish, the pay rise is even worst, no progression. interview process for internal position is rubbish. Communication has gone down hill in the past two years.

job_title: Regional Development Executive in Coventry, England
pros: Clear structures and policies. Staff and colleagues are high quality individuals. Enjoyable working environment.
cons: No cons. Overall I have been very happy working a ABRSM

pros:
Some really great colleagues. 

Relaxed environment and low pressure in administrator roles.
cons:
Talent is severely undervalued. 

The company claims to reward staff based on performance however staff are not rewarded fairly or even recognised for their contribution. 

Hierarchical attitudes at senior management level with severe lack of communication and transparency in decision making that affects employees. 

Public accounts show the highest salary almost doubling from c.170,000 to c.300,000 in 2021 at a time when pay and recruitment freezes were in place. Organisation is willing to create new high-level positions and offer high salaries for senior leadership / CEO but refuses to offer any meaningful pay increase to general staff. Promotions handed out at senior level without due process while requests for recruitment at more junior levels is often met with resistance. 

Does not adjust pay to reflect inflation.

No career progression opportunities once you surpass administrator roles.

pros: Great place to work, people are fantastic!
cons: No issues in the department I was in

review_title: Rubbish pay, no progression, and lacking transparency
pros:
Lots of autonomy if you want it
Semi-flexible re WFH
cons:
No progression.
Pay disproportionately low compared to other organisations and benefits lacking.
Lack of honesty and transparency from leadership.

pros:
- Great people to work with
- Semi-flexible hours
cons: - Not much progression for career

review_title: Don't work here if you want a career
pros: The people but that won't pay your bills
cons: Everything else. No bonuses, no development, nothing

review_title: A shared passion for musical progression
job_title: Regional Development Executive in Bath, England
pros: ABRSM is brimful of talented people who all share a passion for music and an understanding of the positive benefits that learning music can bring. I found the organisation very welcoming and wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to others. The way it adapted to the challenges of pandemic by embracing new, digital options was very impressive.
cons: ABRSM can receive - often unfounded - negativity on its social media channels. This is tough to read when you know how hard the dedicated staff are working behind the scenes to facilitate musical progression for as many people as possible. In actuality, for the silent majority, the organisation provides the gold standard of music exams and is extremely proud to do so.

pros: The people our nice and you can keep a good work life balance
cons: The pay is a bit rubbish

review_title: Seriously undervalue talent within the organisation
job_title: Operations Team Leader in London, England
pros: Becoming more open-minded about flexible working arrangements
cons:
Inconsistent treatment of staff between senior leadership and other employees. Resource distribution issues with significant under-resourcing in several key areas. Past employees not always replaced, existing employees to take on parts of those roles without remuneration.
The organisation claims that it rewards loyalty however there is very little evidence of this.

job_title: Senior Research Executive in London, England
pros: Friendly atmosphere and very nice, support colleagues.
cons: Not a lot of room for growth within my field

pros: I've never felt so welcomed by a company before, from the very top to the very bottom. The support available is commendable and you feel that you are cared for.
cons: Things can get complicated where multiple departments get involved in projects and communication could be improved.

job_title: Global Operations Administrator in London, England
pros: Friendly, social team and a good rotation of tasks.
cons: Salary is a bit low

pros: Supportive managers , friendly organisation, opportunity for pay rise each year and a good HR department.
cons: Communication is sometimes a bit slow between teams within the department. Pay could be a higher.

pros:
- Dedicated team, with an (often understated!) passion for their work
- A changing organisation. If you are interested in helping a traditional organisation become more and more modern then you'd fit in well.
- The general sense of support

I'm on my second stint working at ABRSM. I left to find a role with management responsibilities elsewhere, and returned a few years later to continue that career progression, and because I felt it was the sort of organisation I wanted to work in. Whilst the small size of the company might mean that direct "title" promotions seem rare, the amount of change going on at present means that opportunities for role progression of other sorts are coming thick and fast.
cons: - Competing pressures (there is too much to be done!) - many staff and customers share a desire to help absolutely everyone through our offer, and it can't be done. Can cause tensions.

pros: Lovely (if sterile) working environment, in a building that if you ignore what you're actually doing there, can help you to believe you're doing a worthwhile job in the City. The best thing about this place is the coffee machine.
cons: Micro-managing and entirely incompetent senior management team, who don't trust or like each other and it shows. Burning through money to try to appear 'modern' and up to date, but it's run by second-rate people from top to bottom who wouldn't know what's 'current' if it bit them in the face. There's so much wrong with ABRSM! Stale ideas, two-faced, backbiting colleagues, a lack of collaboration runs through the place like a poison. I've even seen senior managers put down junior  team members  in their goodbye speeches! Never seen this happen anywhere else ever. This is a great place to work if you are not very talented, have no ambition but want to hide behind a known brand (even if that brand is stuck in the 1950s).

review_title: Friendly and nice culture - in need of modernising
pros:
- Lovely people
- Supportive organisation and generally good work/life balance (potential exception of now when dealing with COVID)
- Collective passion for aims of organisation from its staff
cons:
- Systems need updating (currently happening)
- Staff skills not quite in line with organisation's aims
- Business model needs reviewing - (Currently happening)

pros:
The major highlight is the colleagues you will work with - it’s a very supportive and friendly atmosphere
Forward looking ethos, seeking to modernise a well-established and traditional organisation
cons: Some areas of the business can be slower to adapt to new working practices. Not surprising from an old organisation which is positioned in a traditionally conservative sector.

review_title: Insecure old school who suppress and stunt growth of the young
pros: Flexible working. Everyone does what they like. There is no respect for the actual hours. Especially if you have kids. Kids wow that means everything you can get away with
cons: Everything. Poor culture. Lazy directors, no open minded people, intense atmosphere.

pros: ABRSM values its employees and has been very flexible with work/home life balance.  It encourages autonomy within a supportive team.  I enjoy my work here.  I feel appreciated.  There's no hidden agendas.
cons: Can't think of any cons.

pros: I have the joy of working at ABRSM in a very fulfilling role which interacts with all area's of the business and a fantastic team who are very supportive
cons: I can't think of any reason to not enjoy working life at this business

review_title: A nice, modern place to work
job_title: Representative Support Coordinator in London, England
pros: The offices and facilities are nice. Everyone is very approachable.
cons: If you are not from a musical background, I think you would feel quite excluded as a new starter. A lot of the terminology used is pre-assumed musical knowledge.

review_title: Excellent employee care and work environment
job_title: Global Operations Administrator in London, England
pros:
High quality offices and equipment
Great pay grade (at low level)
Brilliant employee care (perks, seminars, mental health care etc)
Friendly environment
Flexible working hours
cons:
Work can be repetitve and boring
The occasional customer can be abrasive

pros: Responsibilities. Good people. Good values.
cons: Not enough training. More time for self-learning would be beneficial. Hours can be long. Pressure can be high

pros: Lovely, talented staff mostly below management/middle management level. Work is in the area of music education.
Friendly People and very helpful.
cons:
No career progression
Routine Tasks
Inconsistency regarding some company polices across departments

pros: ABRSM is a fantastic place to work. Very friendly and helpful colleagues.
cons: Nothing to think about at the moment.

pros: Friendly and supportive staff / management
cons: Slow to make changes / not many progression opportunities

pros: Friendly staff, clear rota and an enjoyable job
cons: I experienced no downsides to this job
